body.$description: Use for general content text, such as paragraphs, descriptions, and instructions. Body is the default text style for most UI content, optimized for readability at 14px.

body-large.$description: Use for content that requires enhanced readability, such as important information, summaries, or sections where larger text improves user experience. Body Large is ideal for supporting main content and titles.

label.$description: Suitable for indicative labels within forms, settings, or other interface elements where clear, non-interactive text is needed. The Label style is designed to provide clear identification of fields, categories, or statuses.

informative.$description: Ideal for alert messages, notifications, and important instructions. The Informative style ensures that crucial information is immediately recognizable to users.

meta.$description: Best for secondary information such as timestamps, footnotes, or additional context. The Meta style is smaller, providing necessary details without overwhelming the primary content.

quote.$description: Use for quotations or highlighted statements within content. The Quote style is designed to distinguish quoted or referenced text from the main content, often with italic emphasis.

lead.$description: Use for introductory or leading text that precedes main content. The Lead style is larger and draws attention to key messages or summaries.

extraSmall.$description: Use for strong action elements (such as buttons) in very compact spaces, where emphasis and clarity are required.

small.$description: Use for strong action elements (such as buttons) in small spaces, providing emphasis and readability.

medium.$description: Use for strong action elements (such as buttons) in medium-sized spaces, balancing emphasis and legibility.

large.$description: Use for strong action elements (such as buttons) in large spaces, ensuring high visibility and impact.

extraSmall.$description: Use for strong action elements in very compact spaces with closer line height, maximizing space efficiency.

small.$description: Use for strong action elements in small spaces with closer line height, maintaining emphasis in limited space.

medium.$description: Use for strong action elements in medium spaces with closer line height, balancing compactness and emphasis.

large.$description: Use for strong action elements in large spaces with closer line height, providing strong emphasis and clarity.

extraSmall.$description: Use for strong action elements in very compact spaces with regular line height, ensuring clarity and emphasis.

small.$description: Use for strong action elements in small spaces with regular line height, providing emphasis and readability.

medium.$description: Use for strong action elements in medium spaces with regular line height, balancing emphasis and legibility.

large.$description: Use for strong action elements in large spaces with regular line height, ensuring high visibility and impact.

extraSmall.$description: Use for regular action elements (such as secondary buttons or links) in very compact spaces, where space efficiency is important.

small.$description: Use for regular action elements in small spaces, providing clarity and accessibility.

medium.$description: Use for regular action elements in medium spaces, balancing compactness and readability.

large.$description: Use for regular action elements in large spaces, ensuring clear and accessible actions.

extraSmall.$description: Use for regular action elements in very compact spaces with closer line height, maximizing space efficiency.

small.$description: Use for regular action elements in small spaces with closer line height, maintaining clarity in limited space.

medium.$description: Use for regular action elements in medium spaces with closer line height, balancing compactness and readability.

large.$description: Use for regular action elements in large spaces with closer line height, ensuring clear and accessible actions.

extraSmall.$description: Use for regular action elements in very compact spaces with regular line height, ensuring clarity and accessibility.

small.$description: Use for regular action elements in small spaces with regular line height, providing clarity and accessibility.

medium.$description: Use for regular action elements in medium spaces with regular line height, balancing compactness and readability.

large.$description: Use for regular action elements in large spaces with regular line height, ensuring clear and accessible actions.

extraSmall.$description: Use for links in very compact spaces, ensuring they remain visible and accessible.

small.$description: Use for links in small spaces, providing clarity and accessibility.

medium.$description: Use for links in medium spaces, balancing visibility and readability.

large.$description: Use for links in large spaces, ensuring high visibility and accessibility.

display1.$description: Use for the largest display text on mobile, such as splash screens or main titles. Provides maximum emphasis.

display2.$description: Use for large display text on mobile, such as section headers or prominent titles.

display3.$description: Use for medium display text on mobile, suitable for sub-headers or highlighted content.

display4.$description: Use for smaller display text on mobile, such as minor section headers or supporting titles.

headline1.$description: Use for the largest headline text on mobile, such as main page titles.

headline2.$description: Use for large headline text on mobile, such as section headers.

headline3.$description: Use for medium headline text on mobile, suitable for sub-headers or highlighted content.

headline4.$description: Use for smaller headline text on mobile, such as minor section headers.

headline5.$description: Use for small headline text on mobile, such as supporting titles or captions.

headline6.$description: Use for the smallest headline text on mobile, such as overlines or minor captions.

display1.$description: Use for the largest display text on desktop, such as splash screens or main titles. Provides maximum emphasis.

display2.$description: Use for large display text on desktop, such as section headers or prominent titles.

display3.$description: Use for medium display text on desktop, suitable for sub-headers or highlighted content.

display4.$description: Use for smaller display text on desktop, such as minor section headers or supporting titles.

headline1.$description: Use for the largest headline text on desktop, such as main page titles.

headline2.$description: Use for large headline text on desktop, such as section headers.

headline3.$description: Use for medium headline text on desktop, suitable for sub-headers or highlighted content.

headline4.$description: Use for smaller headline text on desktop, such as minor section headers.

headline5.$description: Use for small headline text on desktop, such as supporting titles or captions.

headline6.$description: Use for the smallest headline text on desktop, such as overlines or minor captions.
